articles.title: Chinese High-Ranking Military Delegation Here
articles.content:
Chinese High-Ranking Military Delegation Here
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- A Chinese high-ranking military delegation led by Col. General Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China, arrived here Saturday to pay an official goodwill visit to the DPRK at the invitation of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. 
					 The delegation is made up of Col. General Ma Xiaotian, deputy chief of the General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Col. General Tong Shiping, deputy director of the General Political Department of the CPLA, Col. General Li Andong, deputy director of the General Armament Department of the CPLA, Lieut. General Zou Yinhe, deputy director of the General Logistics Department of the CPLA, Lieut. General Wang Hongyao, deputy political commissar of the Shenyang Military Area of the CPLA, Lieut. General Feng Zhaoju, deputy commander of the Jinan Military Area of the CPLA, Maj. General Cao Yumin, deputy director of the General Office of the Central Military Commission, Maj. General Qian Lihua, director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defence of China, Maj. General Zhou Tao, head of the Publicity Department of the General Political Department of the CPLA, general officers and other officers of the CPLA.  
					
					 The delegation was greeted at the airport by Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and officers of the Korean People's Army, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Sun Yanfeng, military, naval and air attache, and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Guo Boxiong released a statement on the arrival. 
					
					 A welcoming ceremony took place in front of the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Memorial Tower.
					
					 Present there were members of the delegation, the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, the military, naval and air attache and staff members of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 Also present there were Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, KPA General Kim Jong Gak, member of the DPRK National Defence Commission and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and general officers and other officers of the KPA.
					
					 Ri Yong Ho and Guo Boxiong reviewed the guard of honor of the KPA after the anthems of China and the DPRK were played.
					
					 Guo Boxiong received bouquets from a woman officer of the KPA and a woman of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: Guo Boxiong Makes Public Written Arrival Speech
articles.content:
Guo Boxiong Makes Public Written Arrival Speech 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Col. General Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China, made public a written speech at the airport upon his arrival in Pyongyang Saturday. 
					 He said in his speech that the Chinese high-ranking military delegation has come to the DPRK to participate in the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers into the Korean front and pay an official goodwill visit to the DPRK at the invitation of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 China and the DPRK are the friendly neighbors having lips-and-teeth relations. 
					
					 The peoples and armies of the two countries have maintained close relations of friendship, supporting and cooperating with each other in the long-drawn struggle against powers' aggression and for the socialist revolution and construction. 
					
					 Six decades ago the CPV fought alongside the people and army of the DPRK and won a great victory in the struggle to defend the regional and world peace.
					
					 The traditional Sino-DPRK friendship which struck deep roots in the minds of the two peoples and stood tests of the complicated international situation serves as precious wealth common to them. 
					
					 I was pleased to learn that the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship forged and cultivated by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries has made a fresh development under the deep care of General Secretary Hu Jintao and General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					  Kim Jong Il visited China twice this year and met Hu Jintao and exchanged views on a series of matters of common concern and reached a common understanding, contributing to further developing the traditional Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations.
					
					 Zhou Yongkang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, visited the DPRK on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea, leading a delegation of the CPC delegation, and participated in its celebrations, once again showing the stand of the Chinese party and government to invariably develop the traditional Sino-DPRK relations of friendship and cooperation. 
					
					 The purpose of my current visit to the DPRK is to put the common understanding achieved by the leaders of the two parties and countries into practice and thus strengthen the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the peoples and armies of the two countries and join the Korean comrades in contributing to the regional and world peace and stability and development. 
					
					 It is my hope that the Sino-DPRK friendship will be handed down through generations and last forever.

articles.title: Ri Yong Ho Meets Chinese High-Ranking Military Delegation
articles.content:
Ri Yong Ho Meets Chinese High-Ranking Military Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, met and had a talk with the Chinese high-ranking military delegation headed by Col. General Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China, when it paid a courtesy call on him on Saturday.
					 Present there were KPA General Kim Jong Gak, member of the DPRK National Defence Commission and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, KPA Generals Jong Myong Do and Ri Pyong Chol and KPA Col. General Kim Myong Hwan and Ambassador Liu Hongcai and Sun Yanfeng, military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy here.

articles.title: NDC of DPRK Hosts Banquet for Chinese High-Ranking Military Delegation
articles.content:
NDC of DPRK Hosts Banquet for Chinese High-Ranking Military Delegation
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The National Defence Commission of the DPRK hosted a banquet on Saturday in honor of the Chinese high-ranking military delegation on an official goodwill visit to the DPRK.
					  Present there on invitation were members of the delegation headed by Col. General Guo Boxiong, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and Sun Yanfeng, military, naval and air attache of the embassy here.
					
					 Present there were Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, KPA General Kim Jong Gak, member of the DPRK National Defence Commission and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, and Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, KPA Generals Jong Myong Do and Ri Pyong Chol, KPA Col. General Kim Myong Hwan and general officers and officers of the KPA.
					
					 Ri Yong Ho made a speech at the banquet.
					
					 He said that the visit of the Chinese high-ranking military delegation greatly encourages the army and people of the DPRK in the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il and it will mark an important occasion in developing the friendly and cooperative relations between the armies of the two countries on a new higher level.
					
					 He noted that the ties of DPRK-China friendship sealed in blood grew stronger in the course of waging a heroic war of resistance against the U.S. imperialist aggressors, the common enemy. 
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK-China friendship which President Kim Il Sung created and tended with Chinese revolutionaries of the elder generation is now growing stronger under the deep care of the top leaders of the two countries.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations would grow stronger thanks to the concerted efforts.
					
					 He wished the army and people of China greater successes in their work to build socialism with Chinese characteristics and develop the CPLA into powerful elite forces under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Hu Jintao as its general secretary.
					
					 Guo Boxiong in his speech stressed that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation which have steadily developed thanks to the joint efforts of the two sides have played an important role in accelerating socialist construction and maintaining the regional peace and stability. 
					
					 He said he witnessed the big successes achieved by the Korean people and army in building a thriving nation under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He expressed warm congratulations to the successful Conference of the WPK which is of weighty significance for the prosperity of the DPRK. 
					
					 He referred to the fact that 60 years ago the peoples and armies of the two countries waged death-defying struggle shoulder to shoulder to win the great victory and recorded a shining chapter of the Sino-DPRK friendship. 
					
					 He said that through the current visit of the delegation it was convinced of the prospect of the development of the relations of friendship and cooperation between the armies of the two countries in the new century.

articles.title: WPK Friendly Delegation Returns
articles.content:
WPK Friendly Delegation Returns
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The friendly delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea led by Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the C.C., the WPK and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, returned home on Saturday after visiting China. 
					 The delegation visited different places of Harbin City in Heilongjiang Province and Changchun and Jilin cities in Jilin Province from October 20 to 22.
					
					 The delegation visited the Harbin Huijiang Foodstuff Company, the Harbin Electrical Group, the Changchun Rolling Stock Company, the Changchun Agricultural Expo, Jilin Yuwen Middle School, the Jilin Chemical Fiber Group and other places.
					
					 During its stay in China the delegation was received by Ji Bingxuan, secretary of the Heilongjiang Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China, Sun Zhengcai, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC, and invited to receptions given by the Heilongjiang and Jilin provincial committees of the CPC and the Changchun and Jilin city committees of the CPC.

articles.title: Boosted China-DPRK Friendship Called for
articles.content:
Boosted China-DPRK Friendship Called for
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Zhou Yongkang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee and secretary of the Central Commission of Politics and Law of the Communist Party of China, who visited the DPRK on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea said that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have grown stronger with each passing day.
					 The exchange and cooperation between the two countries have further developed this year, he said, noting that General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited China two times this year during which he had in-depth exchange of views on issues of common concern and reached an important agreement with General Secretary Hu Jintao.
					
					 He recalled that Kim Jong Il's China visits contributed to developing the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship to a new higher stage.
					
					 We would strive hard together with the Korean comrades for the beautiful future of the bilateral friendship, he said, adding:
					
					 This year is a significant year marking the 60th anniversary of the Chinese People's Volunteers' entry into the Korean front.
					
					 We should carry forward the noble intention of the fallen fighters of the CPV.
					
					 I hope that the flower of the China-DPRK friendship would be brought into fuller bloom.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with gifts by the secretaries of the Jilin Provincial Committee, the Changchun Municipal Committee and the Jilin Municipal Committee of the Communist Party of China.
					 The gifts were respectively handed over to Mun Kyong Dok, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief secretary of the Pyongyang City Committee of the WPK, who is heading the friendly delegation of the WPK on a visit to China by Sun Zhengcai, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC, Gao Guangbin, secretary of the Changchun Municipal Committee, and Zhou Huachen, secretary of the Jilin Municipal Committee, on Friday.

articles.title: "Arirang" Performed to Mark Entry of CPV into Korean Front
articles.content:
"Arirang" Performed to Mark Entry of CPV into Korean Front
 Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, was given at the May Day Stadium Saturday to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the entry of the Chinese People's Volunteers into the Korean front.
					 Appreciating the performance were Kim Yong Nam and Choe Yong Rim, members of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and other leading officials of the party, army and state, officials of the party, armed forces and power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, officials in the fields of science, education, culture and arts, public health and media, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and working people in the city.
					
					 Among the spectators were members of the Chinese high-ranking military delegation, the delegation of veteran fighters of the CPV and the Art Troupe of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK and staff members of his embassy and other Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 An Tong Chun, minister of Culture, said in his speech that the DPRK-China friendship is a treasure common to the armies and peoples of the two countries and unbreakable friendship with eternal vitality as it was forged in blood in the struggle against foreign aggressors and stood storms and ordeals of history.
					
					 As the performance began, there appeared on the background letters "Deepest Respect to the Great Leader, Founder of Our Party" and "Highest Glory to the Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il" turning the ground of the stadium into a veritable sea of flowers and dancers.
					
					 The performance represented as grand epical picture the heroic spirit of our army and people bravely struggling for building a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation and national reunification glorifying the dignity and honor of the country and the nation with the might of harmonious whole of the leader, party and masses under the banner of Songun.
					
					 The scene "Arirang for Friendship" reflecting the steadfast will of the armies and peoples of the two countries to consolidate and develop the traditional DPRK-China friendship generation after generation added luster to the performance. 
					
					 Letters reading "Deepest Respect to the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung and Chinese Leaders of Elder Generation," "Deep-rooted DPRK-China Friendship", etc. appeared on the background in succession while performers in the national costumes of the two countries presented folk dances of China and friendship dances. 
					
					 The performance was acclaimed by the spectators.

articles.title: Song Based on Chinese People's Obligation
articles.content:
Song Based on Chinese People's Obligation 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The River Amnok of Korea is associated with the indestructible friendship between the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and China.
					 The Chinese People's Volunteers crossed the river along with "Song of Chinese People's Volunteers" to join the Korean people in the Korean war (June 1950-July 1953) against the imperialists.
					
					 The song, created in 1950, reflects the volunteers' revolutionary will and internationalist duty to fight valiantly against the U.S. aggressors. Its melody is stirring and vigorous.
					
					 The song sings of their high spirit and confidence in victory in the first part and their pride of taking up a sacred mission of resisting America and aiding Korea, safeguarding the home and defending the motherland in the last part, climaxed with "let's defeat the U.S. imperialists".
					
					 The Korean Cinema Musical Company, in its performance in China last year marking the 60th anniversary of the People's Republic of China and the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and China, put on the stage the song to be acclaimed by the audience.
					
					 The heroic services of the volunteers will remain long in the memory of the Korean people along with the song.

articles.title: Atmosphere of DPRK-China Friendship Pervades Pyongyang
articles.content:
Atmosphere of DPRK-China Friendship Pervades Pyongyang
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- An atmosphere of the DPRK-China friendship is going high in Pyongyang with the approach of the 60th anniversary of the Chinese People's Volunteers' entry in the Korean war.
					 Rodong Sinmun, Minju Joson and other major newspapers of the country have introduced heroic services rendered by the volunteers dispatched by the Chinese Party and Government to the Korean war (June 1950-July 1953) under the banner of resisting America and aiding Korea, safeguarding the home and defending the motherland.
					
					 They have also carried literary works and articles such as an epic titled "The 800-km-long Amnok River" and an article "DPRK-China Friendship Seen through Art Exchange".
					
					 The Korean Central TV has telecasted documentary films on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's visits to China, as well as a Chinese TV drama and performances of Chinese artistes.
					
					 The newly created opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" based on a Chinese folk legend has been performed at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre from October 22.
					
					 A photo exhibition and a week of Chinese film show are also going on in the city to mark the anniversary.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Art Troupe of the Chinese People's Liberation Army has given performances in Pyongyang to sing of the friendship between the two countries.

articles.title: Greetings to Zambian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Zambian President 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Rupiah Bwezani Banda, president of Zambia, on Oct. 21 on the occasion of the 46th anniversary of its independence.
					 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Zambia would grow stronger, he sincerely wished the Zambian president greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Vietnamese Prime Minister
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Vietnamese Prime Minister
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim sent a message of sympathy Saturday to Nguyen Tan Dung, prime minister of the Vietnamese Government, in connection with the recent flood that hit central Vietnam, causing huge human and material losses.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolations to the prime minister and, through him, to the residents in the afflicted regions and hoped that the Vietnamese government and people would overcome the consequences of the flood as soon as possible.

articles.title: DPRK Acrobatics Awarded Gold Prize at Intl' Circus Festival
articles.content:
DPRK Acrobatics Awarded Gold Prize at Intl' Circus Festival
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The 12th Latina International Circus Festival was held in Latina, Italy, from October 14 to 18.
					 It brought together famous acrobatic troupes and acrobats of 17 countries including the DPRK, China, Russia, France, Spain and Colombia.
					
					 In the world famous acrobatics "Stunt Fliers" acrobats of the Pyongyang Circus presented fascinating movements requiring high technique and excellent stunts in the air, mesmerizing the jury and the spectators.
					
					 A DPRK acrobat in "Rope Balancing Etude" presented difficult movements and high skills to be acclaimed by the spectators.
					
					 A prize-awarding ceremony was followed by a closing performance on October 18.
					
					 Gold prize, the highest prize, went to DPRK acrobatics "Stunt Fliers" and bronze prize and an exceptional special prize to "Rope Balancing Etude."

articles.title: Production Goes Up in Metal Industrial Sector
articles.content:
Production Goes Up in Metal Industrial Sector
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Tremendous achievements have been made in the metal industrial sector of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea this year marked by the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Such major steel producers as the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, the Songjin Steel Complex, the Chollima Steel Complex, the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex have completed Juche-based steel-making systems based on fuel available in the country and sharply increased the steel output to contribute to the economic growth. 
					
					 The Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, with the help of scientists, have put modern curved type strand-casting machines into operation to keep the production going on a high level. 
					
					 The Songjin Steel Complex has made scientific and technical preparations for expanding the production capacity and operating furnaces on the basis of latest technologies. 
					
					 The Chollima Steel Complex has built UHP electric arc furnace No. 2 and equipped the Posan Iron Works with an up-to-date oxygen separator. It has also updated or reconditioned existing facilities for Juche-based iron, steel and alloy steel output. 
					
					 The Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, the Chongjin Steel Plant, the Puryong Ferroalloy Factory and the Hungnam Terminal Factory have introduced advanced science and technologies in their production processes.
					
					 The Musan Mining Complex has built a large-sized cone crushing plant capable of quadrupling the earth-scraping capacity.
					
					 The Unryul Mine has finished a project for boosting the iron ore transport capacity, while the Jaeryong Mine provided itself with stopes with large deposits and overfulfilled the yearly plan.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts US Anti-DPRK Nuclear Policy
articles.content:
KCNA Blasts US Anti-DPRK Nuclear Policy 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- It was recently confirmed through declassified documents of the U.S. Administration that the U.S. has persistently examined and planned the use of nuclear weapons against the DPRK for more than half a century, i.e. up to the present Obama Administration since the 1950s.
					 The documents glaringly reveal the root cause of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and the arch criminal posing a nuclear threat to it.
					
					 According to them, the U.S. brought nuclear weapons into the Korean front in mid-August 1950 right after its start of the Korean war. Whenever it was driven to a tight corner militarily and politically during the whole period of the war, it examined the use of nuclear weapons. It conducted several exercises under the simulated conditions of the operations to drop nuclear bombs in the northern half of Korea.
					
					 The successive U.S. presidents including Truman and military brasshats including MacArthur and Schlesinger let loose a string of outbursts threatening to use nukes against the then non-nuclear state DPRK. During the period of the Korean war Truman blustered that the U.S. was actively examining the use of nuclear weapons against the DPRK all the time. And U.S. high-ranking officials had threatened to use nukes against the DPRK on six occasions since 1976, counting only those disclosed.
					
					 The three services of the U.S. forces have vied with each other to play a leading role in mounting a nuclear attack on the DPRK. The period since the 1950s witnessed the working out and updating of a series of nuclear war plans including "OPLAN 8-53" and "OPLAN 5027." Exercises have been staged under these scenarios. 
					
					 The U.S. nuclear threat was a wanton and brazen-faced violation of international law, a total departure from its obligation as a state assigned to custody of the Non-Proliferation Treaty not to pose a nuclear threat to non-nuclear states.
					
					 The NPT has failed to clear the DPRK of the U.S. persistent nuclear threat but has been misused by the U.S. as a means for stifling the DPRK with nukes. This compelled the DPRK to pull out of the NPT and have access to nuclear deterrent legitimately in order to protect the sovereignty and security of the country and the nation.
					
					 As seen above, the root cause of the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula lies in that a belligerent party possessed of nuclear weapons has posed constant undisguised nuclear threat to the other non-nuclear belligerent party. And the U.S. is the chief culprit.
					
					 The U.S. remains unchanged in its ambition to preempt a nuclear attack on the DPRK. 
					
					 In the Nuclear Posture Review published this April the Obama Administration did not hesitate to adopt the preemptive use of nuclear weapons against the DPRK as its policy.
					
					 It was entirely thanks to the DPRK which has countered the U.S. blatant nuclear threat with a just measure for having access to nuclear deterrent that the nuclear imbalance on the Korean Peninsula was put to an end and the danger of a nuclear war drastically reduced. The DPRK's nuclear deterrent serves as a treasured sword for defending the peace and security of Northeast Asia and the DPRK was entirely right when it opted for having access to nukes.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers have claimed that the nuclear issue was spawned on the Korean Peninsula and no solution has been found to it due to the "nuclear threat" of the DPRK. It is the universally accepted understanding of the world community that this propaganda is a sheer fabrication and the DPRK was quite right and appropriate when it decided to have access to nuclear deterrence.
					
					 American and Japanese experts on international issues said that the experts on the Korean issue generally admit the assertion made by the DPRK that it developed nuclear weapons as a defensive means to cope with the U.S. deployment of nuclear weapons in south Korea, noting that the U.S. option for nuclear attack provides the DPRK with a pretext for developing, acquiring and possessing nuclear weapons. This is by no means accidental.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to stop the anti-DPRK nuclear racket based on lies and hypocrisy and take fundamental measures to settle the nuclear issue on the peninsula.

articles.title: WPK's Birthday Observed
articles.content:
WPK's Birthday Observed 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- Receptions, Korean book and photo exhibitions and film shows took place at the DPRK missions in Shenyang of China, Cuba, Bangladesh, Egypt, Uganda, Peru, Brazil, Italy, Sweden, Austria, Bulgaria, Germany, Britain and France between October 5 and 9 on the occasion of the 65th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 On display in the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos on their immortal exploits and other books and photos introducing the path of victory and glory covered by the WPK. 
					
					 Participants of the film shows watched Korean films including "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and "Pyongyang at Night."
					
					 Speeches were made at the events.
					
					 A standing member of the Liaoning Provincial Committee of the Communist Party of China said that over the last 65 years the WPK has led the Korean people to establish people's power and achieve steady signal successes in all the fields of socialist construction in the spirit of fortitude. It is now dashing ahead to build a thriving nation, he added.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Korean people under the leadership of the WPK headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il would open up a new phase for the development of the state and achieve successes in building a great prosperous and powerful nation. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Peruvian Communist Party said the future of the WPK having Kim Jong Il as its general secretary and the Korean people is bright and the cause of socialism is sure to triumph. 
					
					 The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Italy noted that under the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il the WPK has been developed into the most revolutionary and militant party in the world.
					
					 The spokesman (leader) of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) noted that the WPK, the party of Kim Il Sung, under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il would record only victory and glory as an invincible and steel-strong party.

articles.title: Reception Given by DPRK Embassy in Russia
articles.content:
Reception Given by DPRK Embassy in Russia
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- A reception was given by the DPRK embassy in Moscow on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Russia on Oct. 20.
					 Present there on invitation were Vice Foreign Minister Borodavkin and other officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Transport, the Ministry of Agriculture, the Itar-Tass News Agency and the Ria-Novosti of Russia.
					
					 Charge d'Affaires a.i. O Sung Ho and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Moscow were present there.
					
					 The participants first looked round the photos showing the Korean people bringing about miracles and innovations in the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 O Sung Ho referred to the fact that the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Russia 62 years ago marked an event of great significance in developing the friendship and cooperation between the two peoples in various fields, adding that since the establishment of diplomatic relations the two countries have positively developed the friendly and cooperative ties in political, economic and cultural and all other fields in conformity with the desire and wishes of their peoples.
					
					 Noting that it is the consistent stand of the DPRK government to invariably boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries according to the spirit of the DPRK-Russia joint documents and the inter-state treaty, he reiterated the will to make positive efforts to do so.
					
					 Borodavkin recalled that the Russo-DPRK diplomatic relations were established on Oct. 12, 1948, noting that thanks to the concerted efforts the mutually-beneficial relations would display fresh vitality in political, economic, cultural, scientific  and various other fields in the future, too.
					
					 Russia has consistently stood for peace and security and a political solution to the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula, he said, sincerely hoping that the difficulties lying in the way of the inter-Korean relations would be overcome by the efforts of the Korean people themselves.

articles.title: Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported
articles.content:
Proposal for Founding DFRK Supported 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- The South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People made public a statement on October 15 on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
					 Referring to the proposal for founding the DFRK set forth by President Kim Il Sung at the Sixth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea in October 1980, the statement continued:
					
					 In order to materialize the above-said proposal without fail General Secretary Kim Jong Il made sure that the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration was adopted in 2000 the keynote of which is to independently solve the issue of national reunification by the concerted efforts of the Koreans and work for achieving reunification by federal formula and the October 4 declaration, its action programme, was published in 2007. 
					
					 As a result, Korea came to have a clear-cut programme and a solid foundation for achieving the reunification of the country as early as possible under the banner of the great national unity. 
					
					 Korea's reunification is, however, facing a blatant challenge.
					
					 We strongly demand the south Korean authorities accept the proposal for founding the DFRK and the June 15 joint declaration favored by all Koreans and the international community as a milestone of reunification and promptly opt for implementing it.
					
					 We recognize the above-said proposal as the most reasonable and fair and aboveboard one for Korea's reunification and fully support it.
					
					 We reiterate our will to join the world progressives in their efforts to materialize the proposal for founding the DFRK and the June 15 joint declaration, in the future, too.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia 
Pyongyang, October 23 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Workers' Party of Korea Is a Juche-Type Revolutionary Party Which Inherited the Glorious Tradition of the DIU" was brought out in booklet by the Russian Association for Development of Friendship and Cooperation with Foreign Countries on October 17. 
					 The work, published on October 17, Juche 71 (1982), deals with the idea that the WPK is a revolutionary party, which has paved a new road for its development with its long history, and a Juche-type revolutionary party which conducts revolutionary activities independently and creatively, guided by the Juche idea. It also clarifies the position and role of the party in accomplishing the socialist cause.

articles.title: ATCC califica de justa la posesion del disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC
articles.content:
ATCC califica de justa la posesion del disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- Segun los documentos recien desclasificados de la administracion norteamericana, se ha confirmado que durante mas de medio siglo desde la decada de 1950 hasta la actual administracion Obama, Estados Unidos ha venido examinando y planeando constantemente el uso de armas nucleares contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					  Estos documentos revelan claramente donde esta la causa del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana  y quien es el culpable de la amenaza nuclear.
					
					  Segun ellos, EE.UU. introdujo las armas nucleares en el frente coreano ya a mediados de agosto de 1950, o sea, inmediatamente despues de desatada la  guerra coreana.
					
					  Cada vez que caia en el atolladero en sentido politico-militar durante la guerra, examino el uso de artefacto nuclear y desarrollo en varias ocasiones los ejercicios de lanzamiento de tal arma en la extension de la RPDC.
					
					  Los anteriores presidentes y cabecillas militares de EE.UU. como Truman, MacAthur y Schlesinger pronunciaron sucesivos disparates amenazando con armas nucleares a la RPDC, pais desnuclearizado en aquel entonces.
					
					  En el periodo de la guerra coreana, Truman dijo que "esta examinando en todo momento y activamente el uso de armas nucleares" contra Corea. Tambien, en el periodo posterior al ano 1976, los altos funcionarios de EE.UU. amenazaron 6 veces a la RPDC con usar las armas nucleares.
					
					   En su competencia para cumplir el papel protagonico en el golpe nuclear contra la RPDC, las fuerzas terrestres, navales y aereas de EE.UU. elaboraron, renovaron y ejercitaron por separado desde la decada de 1950 hasta la fecha los planes de guerra nuclear como "OPLAN 8-53", "Freedom Dravvy" y "OPLAN 5027".
					
					  La amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. devino una flagrante y cinica violacion de la ley internacional porque como signatario del Tratado de No Proliferacion Nuclear tiene la obligacion de no amenazar con armas nucleares a los Estados desnuclearizados.
					
					  Puesto que ese tratado no elimina la permanente amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. y fue usado por este como espacio para aplastar con armas nucleares a Corea, esta procuro el disuasivo nuclear retirandose justamente del tratado para defender la soberania y la seguridad del pais y la nacion.
					
					  Como se ve, la causa del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana reside en que una parte beligerante portadora de armas nucleares no ceso de ejercer abiertamente la amenaza nuclear a la otra parte desnuclearizada.
					
					  Tanto ayer como hoy sigue invariable la ambicion de EE.UU. de atacar con esos artefactos a la RPDC.
					
					  En el "informe de revision del estado nuclear" publicado en abril de este ano, la administracion Obama definio abiertamente como su politica el uso preventivo de armas nucleares contra la  RPDC.
					
					  Si la RPDC hubiera cifrado su esperanza solo en el dialogo o la ley internacional ante la recrudescente amenaza de guerra nuclear de EE.UU., ya habria estallado esta guerra en la Peninsula Coreana  y la nacion coreana y la region del Nordeste Asiatico habrian sufrido inevitablemente los desastres nucleares.
					
					  Ya que la RPDC poseyo el justo disuasivo nuclear haciendo frente a la brutal amenaza nuclear de EE.UU., se rompio el estado desequilibrado nuclear y se disminuyo considerablemente el peligro de guerra en la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					  Por lo tanto, el disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC deviene el medio omnipotente para preservar la paz y la seguridad del Nordeste Asiatico y la posesion del mismo fue la opcion mil veces justa.
					
					  Hoy dia, la sociedad internacional reconoce que es un invento de punta a cabo la propaganda de EE.UU. y sus fuerzas satelites de que el problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana fue generado y sigue pendiente por la "amenaza nuclear" de Corea y que es muy justa la posesion del disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC.
					
					  Los especialistas en el problema coreano admiten en general el argumento de la RPDC de que esta desarrollo sus artefactos nucleares como medio defensivo frente al emplazamiento de armas nucleares norteamericanas en el Sur de Corea.
					
					  No por casualidad, el norteamericano Selig Harrison y el japones Yoshiki Mine, especialistas en asuntos internacionales, dijeron que es cierto que la opcion de ataque nuclear de EE.UU. "da al Norte de Corea el pretexto de desarrollo, adquisicion y posesion de armas nucleares".
					
					  EE.UU. debe abandonar sus enganosos y fraudulentos alborotos nucleares contra la RPDC y tomar las medidas fundamentales para la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.

articles.title: Acrobacia coreana gana premio de oro en festival internacional
articles.content:
Acrobacia coreana gana premio de oro en festival internacional
 Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar del dia 14 al 18 en la ciudad de Latina de Italia el XII Festival Internacional de Circo de Latina.
					  En la ocasion participaron las famosas entidades de circo y los acrobatas de 17 paises, incluyendo Corea, China, Rusia, Francia, Espana y Colombia.
					
					  Los acrobatas del Conjunto Circense de Pyongyang, que actuaron en la pieza de fama mundial "Aviadores", conmovieron a los miembros del  jurado y espectadores cumpliendo magnificamente en suspension sus movimientos de alto nivel y excelentes habilidades.
					
					  La actriz de "Equilibrismo sobre cuerda" ha sido elogiada tambien por haber mostrado sus movimientos tecnicos muy dificiles.
					
					  El dia 18, tuvieron lugar la ceremonia de premiacion y la funcion de clausura.
					
					  En la ceremonia fueron otorgados el premio de oro (maximo galardon del evento) a la acrobacia coreana "Aviadores" y el de bronce y el especial instituido excepcionalmente a "Equilibrismo sobre cuerda".

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presentes de cuadros chinos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presentes de cuadros chinos
Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibio presentes que le dirigieran el secretario del Comite Provincial del Partido Comunista de China en Jilin, Sun Zhengcai, el secretario del Comite Municipal del PCCh en Changchun, Gao Guangbin, y el secretario del Comite Municipal del PCCh en Jilin, Zhou Huachen.
					　Los regalos fueron trasladados por separado el dia 22 a Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del Buro Politico y secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, quien realiza una visita a China presidiendo la delegacion de amistad del PTC.

articles.title: Se acentua en Corea el ambiente de amistad con China
articles.content:
Se acentua en Corea el ambiente de amistad con China
Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 60o aniversario de la participacion del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en el frente coreano, toma auge en esta capital el ambiente de amistad Corea-China.
					  Rodong Sinmun, Minju Joson y otros periodicos centrales difunden los articulos relatando que durante la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria (junio de 1950-julio de 1953), el partido y el gobierno de China enviaron al frente coreano el cuerpo de voluntarios organizado con los mejores hijos de la nacion china bajo la bandera de "resistir a los yanquis, ayudar a Corea, y defender el hogar y el pais propios".
					
					  Los periodicos transmiten con detalles los combates que realizaron los voluntarios chinos junto con los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea en la misma trinchera para rechazar a las fuerzas agresoras imperialistas manifestando su incomparable espiritu de sacrificio y heroismo masivo.
					
					  En los articulos como la epopeya "Dos mil ries del rio Amnok" y "Amistad Corea-China vista mediante la historia de intercambio artistico" llaman a consolidar la amistad Corea-China con larga historia y magnifica tradicion.
					
					  En la television central de Corea se proyectan los documentales sobre la visita a China del Dirigente          Kim Jong Il.
					
					  Igualmente, se transmiten una telenovela china bajo el titular de "Con motivo del 60o aniversario de la participacion del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en el frente coreano" y la funcion de los artistas chinos.
					
					  En el Gran Teatro de Pyongyang tiene lugar a partir del dia 22 la funcion de la opera "Liang Shanbo y Zhu Yingtai", creada a base de la famosa leyenda popular de China, centrando la gran atencion de los capitalinos.
					
					  Tienen lugar solemnemente por otra parte la fotoexhibicion y el ciclo de cine chino por la misma efemeride.
					
					  El grupo artistico del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh), de visita en Corea, fomenta tambien la amistad entre los pueblos de los dos paises, establecida firmemente con la fraternidad y unidad combativas, ofreciendo en esta capital funciones artisticas.

articles.title: En Pyongyang delegacion militar de alto nivel de China
articles.content:
En Pyongyang delegacion militar de alto nivel de China
Pyongyang, 23 de octubre (ATCC) -- Arribo el dia 23 a esta capital la delegacion militar de alto nivel de China encabezada por el coronel general Guo Boxiong, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central de la Republica Popular China, para realizar una visita oficial y de amistad a Corea cumplimentando la invitacion del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					  La delegacion esta integrada por los generales y oficiales como el coronel general Ma Xiaotian, subjefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh), el coronel general Tong Shiping, subdirector del Departamento Politico General del EPLCh, el coronel general Li Andong, subdirector del Desarrollo de Armamento General del EPLCh, el teniente general Zou Yinhe, subdirector del Departamento Logistico General del EPLCh, el teniente general Wang Hongyao, subcomisario politico de la Zona Militar de Shenyang del EPLCh, el teniente general Feng Zhaoju, subcomandante de la Zona Militar de Jinan, el mayor general Cao Yumin, subdirector de la Oficina General de la Comision Militar Central, el mayor general Qian Lihua, director de la Oficina de Asuntos Exteriores del Ministerio de Defensa Nacional, el mayor general Zhou Dao, jefe de Seccion de Publicidad del Departamento Politico General del EPLCh.
					
					　En el aeropuerto los huespedes chinos fueron acogidos por el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Pak Jae Gyong, oficiales del Ejercito Popular de Corea, el embajador Liu Hongcai y el agregado militar Sun Yanfeng de la sede diplomatica china en Corea.
					
					  En el aeropuerto Guo Boxiong hizo publica la declaracion de llegada.
					
					  Tuvo lugar la ceremonia de bienvenida a la delegacion en la explanada frente al Monumento a la Victoria en la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria.
					
					  En esta ocasion participaron los miembros de la delegacion militar china, el embajador, el agregado militar y otros miembros de la embajada china.
					
					  Por la parte coreana estuvieron presentes el vicemariscal del EPC Ri Yong Ho, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, el general de ejercito del EPC Kim Jong Gak, miembro del CDN de la RPDC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Pak Jae Gyong, viceministro de las FAP, generales y oficiales del EPC.
					
					  Tras la interpretacion de los himnos nacionales de ambos paises, Ri Yong Ho y Guo Boxiong pasaron revista a la guardia de honor del EPC. 
					
					  Guo Boxiong recibio los ramos de flores que le dedicaron una militar coreana y una mujer de la embajada china.
